title: How to Download to a Different Folder in Chrome, Safari, Edge & Firefox

steps.title: Open Google Chrome.
steps.content: Open Google Chrome. It's a red, green, yellow, and blue sphere-shaped icon.

steps.title: Click ⋮.
steps.content: Click ⋮ . This icon is in the top-right side of the Chrome window.

steps.title: Click Settings.
steps.content: Click Settings . It's near the bottom of the drop-down menu.

steps.title: Click Downloads.
steps.content: Click Downloads . It's in the left-hand sidebar, and it has an icon of downwards-facing arrow.

steps.title: Click Change next to the "Location" heading.
steps.content: Click Change next to the "Location" heading. It's at the top of the screen. Your current download location will be displayed under the Location heading.

steps.title: Select a folder.
steps.content: Select a folder. Click a folder into which you want downloads to save.

steps.title: Click Select folder.
steps.content: Click Select folder . It's in the bottom-right corner of the window. This will choose the folder you clicked as the default location for any subsequent downloads. You can also toggle Ask where to save each file before downloading to enable or disable a prompt for each download.

steps.title: Open Safari.
steps.content: Open Safari. This app resembles a blue compass. You'll likely find it in your Mac's Dock.

steps.title: Go to Safari > Settings.
steps.content: Go to Safari > Settings . The Safari menu is in the upper-left corner of the screen, along the top bar.

steps.title: Click the drop-down box next to File download location.
steps.content: Click the drop-down box next to File download location . This box is near the bottom of the window.

steps.title: Click Other….
steps.content: Click Other… . It's at the bottom of the drop-down menu. Doing so opens a Finder window. You can also click Ask for each download in this menu to have Safari ask you to select a specific location for each individual download.

steps.title: Select a folder.
steps.content: Select a folder. Click a folder in the Finder to select it as your default download location.

steps.title: Click Select.
steps.content: Click Select . This will choose the folder you clicked as the default location for any subsequent downloads.

steps.title: Open Microsoft Edge.
steps.content: Open Microsoft Edge. This app icon resembles a green and blue swoosh in the shape of an "e".

steps.title: Click ⋯.
steps.content: Click ⋯ . It's in the top-right corner of the Edge window.

steps.title: Click Settings.
steps.content: Click Settings . This option is near the bottom of the drop-down menu, and it has an icon of a cog wheel.

steps.title: Click Downloads in the left-hand sidebar.
steps.content: Click Downloads in the left-hand sidebar. It has an icon of a downward facing arrow.

steps.title: Click Change next to the "Location" heading.
steps.content: Click Change next to the "Location" heading. It's at the top of the screen. Your current download location will be displayed under the Location heading.

steps.title: Select a folder.
steps.content: Select a folder. Click a folder into which you want downloads to save.

steps.title: Click Select folder.
steps.content: Click Select folder . It's in the bottom-right corner of the window. This will choose the folder you clicked as the default location for any subsequent downloads. You can also toggle Ask me what to do with each download to enable or disable a prompt for each download.

steps.title: Open Firefox.
steps.content: Open Firefox. This is the globe-shaped icon with an orange fox wrapped around it.

steps.title: Click ☰.
steps.content: Click ☰ . It's in the top-right corner of the Firefox window. This prompts a drop-down menu to appear.

steps.title: Click Settings.
steps.content: Click Settings . It's near the bottom of the menu.

steps.title: Scroll down to find the Downloads section.
steps.content: Scroll down to find the Downloads section. It's under the Files and Applications header in the General tab, which is the default tab when you open your Firefox settings. If you aren't on the General tab, click it in the left-hand sidebar first.

steps.title: Click Browse (Windows) or Choose (Mac).
steps.content: Click Browse (Windows) or Choose (Mac). This button is on the right side of the current download folder's name. Clicking it opens a window with folders on your computer listed.

steps.title: Select a folder.
steps.content: Select a folder. Click a folder into which you want downloads to save.

steps.title: Click Select Folder.
steps.content: Click Select Folder . This will choose the folder you clicked as the default location for any subsequent downloads. If you would prefer to be asked where to save a download every time you download something, click the radio button next to Always ask you where to save files .
